intro: Amsinckia truncata, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. Amsinckia truncata has a deep root system that allows it to thrive in arid environments. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss.
